subject: Re: [junit] How can i test a geter or seter?
msgSnippet: Just call setI(int) in your testcase, use getI() to read it back and make sure it matches. ... -- Eric Vought Chief Technical Officer - QLUE Consulting, Inc.
messageBody:
Just call setI(int) in your testcase, use getI() to read it back and make
sure it matches.

On Fri, 21 Dec 2001, montop2000 wrote:

> class A {
> private int i;
> getI(){
> return i;
> }
> }
>
> I want test the geter,should i make testcase as a inner class?
>
>
